metadata.title: CVE-2020-12272 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
OpenDMARC through 1.3.2 and 1.4.x allows attacks that inject authenticationresults to provide false information about the domain that originated ane-mail message. This is caused by incorrect parsing and interpretation ofSPF/DKIM authentication results, as demonstrated by theexample.net(.example.com substring.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopendmarc2 - 1.4.2-1
opendmarc - 1.4.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opendmarc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-1').
